main event: A round, orange light was observed moving in a straight and circular flight pattern over Neustadt, Germany on August 4, 1954.
interesting points: The object appeared to rise slowly from 15-60 degrees, then make a 180-degree turn as it made its final observations.
The object was observed for 35 minutes by a ground-visual witness.
The witness could not sleep and looked out the window, spotting the object at an angle between 45-65 degrees in azimuth around 40 degrees.
The object was also observed at an angle between 45-62 degrees in azimuth around 132 degrees.
The weather was clear and cloudless with a bright night sky.
sighted object: a round, orange light with a straight and circular flight pattern
witnesses: a ground-visual witness, a housewife from Neustadt
photographs: no photographs included in the report
